# PYTHAGORAS

![](data:image/png;base64,)


```python
from math import sqrt
print("Input lengths of shorter triangle sides:")
a=float(input("a:  "))
b=float(input("b:  "))

c=sqrt(a**2 + b**2)
print("The length of the hypotenuse is", c)
```

    Input lengths of shorter triangle sides:
    a:  4
    b:  3
    The length of the hypotenuse is 5.0
    


```python
from math import sqrt
print("Input lengths of shorter triangle sides:")
a=float(input("a:  "))
b=float(input("b:  "))

c=sqrt(a**2 + b**2)
print("The length of the hypotenuse is", c)
```

    Input lengths of shorter triangle sides:
    a:  3
    b:  4
    The length of the hypotenuse is 5.0
    

# COMPOUND INTEREST

![](https://www.thecalculatorsite.com/images/compound-interest-formula-diagram.png)


```python
def compound_interest(principle, rate, time):
    result = principle * (pow((1 + rate / 100), time))
    return result

p = float(input("Enter the principal amount: "))
r = float(input("Enter the interest rate: "))
t = float(input("Enter the time in years: "))

amount = compound_interest(p, r, t)
interest = amount - p
print("Compound amount is %.2f" % amount)
print("Compound interest is %.2f" % interest)
```

    Enter the principal amount: 2000
    Enter the interest rate: 5
    Enter the time in years: 10
    Compound amount is 3257.79
    Compound interest is 1257.79
    

# LOGARTHMIC

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)


```python
import math 
# Printing the log base e of 14 
print ("Natural logarithm of 14 is : ", end="") 
print (math.log(14))  
```

    Natural logarithm of 14 is : 2.6390573296152584
    


```python
import math 
# Printing the log base 5 of 14 
print ("Logarithm base 5 of 14 is : ", end="") 
print (math.log(14,5)) 
```

    Logarithm base 5 of 14 is : 1.6397385131955606
    


```python
import math 
# Printing the log base 10 of 14 
print ("Logarithm base 10 of 14 is : ", end="") 
print (math.log(14,10)) 
# Printing the log base 2 of 14 
print ("Logarithm base 2 of 14 is : ", end="") 
print (math.log(14,2)) 
```

    Logarithm base 10 of 14 is : 1.1461280356782377
    Logarithm base 2 of 14 is : 3.8073549220576037
    

# MATRIX

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)


```python
import numpy
#Two matrices are initialized by value
x = numpy.array([[1, 2], [4, 5]])
y = numpy.array([[7, 8], [9, 10]])
```


```python
#  add()is used to add matrices
print ("Addition of two matrices: ")
print (numpy.add(x,y))
```

    Addition of two matrices: 
    [[ 8 10]
     [13 15]]
    

![](data:image/png;base64,)


```python
print ("Multiplication of two matrices: ")
print (numpy.multiply(x,y))
```

    Multiplication of two matrices: 
    [[ 7 16]
     [36 50]]
    

![](data:image/png;base64,)


```python
print ("dot of two matrices: ")
print (numpy.dot(x,y))
```

    dot of two matrices: 
    [[25 28]
     [73 82]]
    

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)


```python
print ("Matrix transposition : ")
print (x.T)
```

    Matrix transposition : 
    [[1 4]
     [2 5]]
    

# DIFFERENTIATION

![](https://www.brainkart.com/media/extra2/K4urYXK.jpg)


```python
import sympy as sym
```


```python
x = sym.Symbol('x')
sym.diff(x**5)
```




    5*x**4




```python
x,y,z = sym.symbols('x y z')
```


```python
f=x**2*y*z**5
```


```python
sym.diff(f,x)
```




    2*x*y*z**5




```python
sym.diff(f,y)
```




    x**2*z**5




```python
import math
def calc_diff(n,v):
    return n*v**(n-1)

def mul_diff(a,va,b,vb):
    return (va**a)*calc_diff(b,vb)+calc_diff(a,va)*(vb**b)

mul_diff(2,2,1,2)
```




    12



# TRIGONOMETRY

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/dc/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AF%D9%88%D8%A7%D9%84_%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%AB%D9%84%D8%AB%D9%8A%D9%91%D8%A9.gif)

![](http://wp.talentsprint.com:84/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Artboard1copy20-10028129.jpg)


```python
import math
a = math.pi/6
   
# returning the value of sine of pi/6 
print ("The value of sin of pi/6 is : ", end="") 
print (math.sin(a)) 
```

    The value of sin of pi/6 is : 0.49999999999999994
    


```python
import math
a = math.pi/6
   
# returning the value of sine of pi/6 
print ("The value of cos of pi/6 is : ", end="") 
print (math.cos(a)) 
```

    The value of cos of pi/6 is : 0.8660254037844387
    


```python
import math
a = math.pi/6
   
# returning the value of tan of pi/6 
print ("The value of tan of pi/6 is : ", end="") 
print (math.tan(a)) 

b = math.pi/4
   
# returning the value of tan of pi/4
print ("The value of tan of pi/4 is : ", end="") 
print (math.tan(b)) 
```

    The value of tan of pi/6 is : 0.5773502691896257
    The value of tan of pi/4 is : 0.9999999999999999
    


```python
import math
a = math.pi/6

print ("The value of sec of pi/6: ", end="")
print (1/math.cos(a))
```

    The value of sec of pi/6: 1.1547005383792515
    


```python
#tan(x+y) = tanx + tany/1-tanx.tany

import math
a = math.pi/6
b = math.pi/4

print ("The value of tan(a+b) is : ", end="")
print (math.tan(a)+math.tan(b)/1-(math.tan(a))*(math.tan(b)))
```

    The value of tan(a+b) is : 1.0
    


```python
1.576/1-(0.577)*(0.999)
```




    0.9995770000000002
